comment: The exam is very similar to the demo problems and in class exercises. He will sometimes pull quiz questions too. USE THE STUDY GUIDE!! The stuff he goes over on there will be on exams. Plenty of opportunities for extra credit. A group research paper that's really easy. An A is very much doable. Just practice the problems and you're good!
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Group projects--Clear grading criteria

comment: Definitely a nice professor. Walking you through all the materials with examples. In-class attempt are counted toward your grade, as long as you attend, right/wrong answers do not matter.

This professor is very knowledgeable and kind, however the material is a little difficult to understand. He is extremely willing to help. He allows one note card for tests. Grades for connect HW, Quizes, and SB. While attendance is not "mandatory" it is a small part of your grade and missing definitely effects your learning. He also curves grades.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Clear grading criteria--Lecture heavy

comment: I felt like this class was easier than intermediate 1. Exams are in person and split between 12 multiple choice questions and 2 free responses. He lets you use an index card on the exams. Lots of easy points to be earned through Connect work.
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Clear grading criteria

comment: Absolutely loved Professor Hong! This class has difficult concepts, but Professor Hong explained concepts well. He does many demo problems in class that are very helpful. Pay attention and study and you will do fine. You will not pass this class if you do not attend.
rating_tags: Lecture heavy--Test heavy

comment: Hong was great! Very nice man who cares about your welfare in the class and is willing to meet outside of class. Like anything, accounting requires practice and the HW and quiz assignments do help. He also reviews the material and provides clear instructions on what to study for. I enjoyed the class and learned a lot.
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Caring--Accessible outside class

comment: Professor Hong is one of the best accounting professors I've had. He does a good job clearly explaining the material, is very friendly, and gives very helpful feedback.
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: This professor is not a good teacher. He makes this difficult class much more difficult. His PowerPoints are incomplete. He struggles greatly with explaining concepts.
Professor Hong did very well in teaching the class. He provided many opportunities to get extra credit and told us exactly what was on the tests.
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Clear grading criteria--Lecture heavy

comment: Professor Hong knows his material. He is straight to point and does not waste any time while he is instructing. He provides extra credit opportunities. Attendance is not required, but you will not pass since we do in class assignments. Grading is on a point scale so earning the most points possible will help even if you do poorly on exams.
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Clear grading criteria--Test heavy

comment: A really solid professor, I see a lot of reviews and they were mostly from 2 years ago or so. He has either changed his ways or is inconsistent, but I took him and he was great. He teaches very clearly and everything graded very clearly.
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Clear grading criteria--Respected

comment: Professor Hong is probably the best accounting teacher I have had at KSU to date. He is a very clear grader, is very kind (he even made the effort to know everyone's names), and he gives many opportunities to boost your score despite the exams being worth a majority of the grade. If you are this high up in accounting courses, take him. He is great!
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Clear grading criteria--Test heavy

comment: One of the worst professors I have ever taken. So unclear, makes the class unnecessarily hard, and just all around a very difficult class for absolutely NO reason. I don't understand how he has any good reviews. He told us the first day of class to be prepared to "struggle" and "fail."

Professor Hong is very knowledgeable about accounting and is generally an okay professor but his handwriting and accent can be hard to understand at times. I struggled a lot in this class but if you do your work and put conscious effort in you'll do fine.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Lecture heavy--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Has an accent that is hard to understand. Horrible hand writing. Tough class overall and he does not make it much easier. He does reach out to students though so I will credit him for that.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Lecture heavy

comment: Professor Hong is a great teacher. The examples he provides in class are very clear, though there are many times I had to take pictures of the display to look back on. I took his class in person, and there would be random pop quizzes, an incentive to attend class regularly. He gives bonus opportunities and other work to really pad your grade.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria

comment: After our first exam DH told my class that the exam average was lower than he expected and that we should just try harder. Great, thanks. Its never his fault.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Test heavy--Lecture heavy

comment: Solid choice for a professor, doesn't make the class too hard and is a good teacher.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Participation matters--Clear grading criteria

comment: The professor was an above-average accounting professor. The material is just naturally hard for most people. The format was similar to Acct2100 with Smartbooks, homework, and quizzes. He went over the PowerPoint slides in each class with in-class exercises and examples on connect. The standard workload for an accounting class. Would take it again.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Clear grading criteria--Lecture heavy

comment: Personally found it really difficult to learn the material with this professor. Quizzes and Exams are all recorded and closed book/no notes. He changed due dates and moved them forward, which is insane for a course like this with so much information to learn. I felt as if there wasnt enough time or resources to be successful.

I have had professor Hong two times now. He is easily my favorite accounting professor and I will always jump at the opportunity to take him. He has amazing lectures, in depth content and plain explanations. He is seriously the best professor I have ever had.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Amazing lectures--Caring

comment: He is young and new so he is a work in progress. However, he strives to improve and is very adaptable. A lot of bonus point opportunities.

Honestly he is a good professor, the class itself is hard. He taught the material well, and anytime I had a question, he or a TA was happy to help. LOTS of extra credit, homework, and lots of other assignments to balance out your grade if you do bad on an exam. The in class is always on Fridays so do not miss a Friday class. Highly Recommend!
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Disappointed with his class. Difficult to understand, poor explainer of material, never updates grades, exams that aren't like the practice HW/problems, assigned seating, etc. He received many high ratings on here, which is why I chose him, but I was underwhelmed by him as a professor. Would not take again
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy

comment: Professor Hong was an extremely sweet professor. Lots of people who rated him on here as a bad professor just because they struggled with the class. He is from another country, he has an accent, but if you ever needed help, he was available to help. He went extremely slow in class trying not to lose anyone. He is a good teacher, take him.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Clear grading criteria--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Prof. Hong has many high ratings on here, but I'm honestly unsure why. Hard tests that cover material that wasn't discussed, seating chart, rude tone, doesn't explain anything well, weekly in-class activities that always seem to hurt your grade. Very disappointed with this class, especially after reading all of these great reviews. Do not recommend
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy--Lecture heavy

comment: This professor is not worth it. I was greatly misled by his reviews. He makes you do mandatory in-class assignments that will hurt your grade. And he likes to baby students that paid their money for his class by giving them a seating chart on test days. We are the ones paying for this class and you tell us where to sit? No. Don't take this guy.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: I chose Professor Hong due to his high ratings on this website, but I was thoroughly disappointed in him as a professor. Heavy accent makes him very difficult to understand. Came off as rude numerous time during lectures and when asking him questions. By no means is he a awful professor, but he wasn't nearly as good as others reviews had claimed.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy--Lecture heavy

comment: Daily questions to check attendance but not terribly difficult. Gives review extra credit before each test and gives extra credit for going to the learning assistants. Tests aren't too hard. Kind of like the quizzes. Gives you a cheat sheet for the final. Lots of homework and learnsmart grades to balance out a bad test grade. Easy A if you try.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: He is a nice guy, and I would have gotten a better grade if I went to class and turned stuff in online but, I a stupid boy.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: TAKE HONG! He's a very nice guy and will work with you to get the grade that you want. 2 tests, 1 final, tons of Connect assignments and in-class assignments. While the professor is great, this class is by no means a joke, accounting is not easy, but Hong can definitely help through it, he is always ready to help those that ask for it
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy--Lecture heavy

comment: He is a very good choice! Good at teaching, very patient, kind, and gives tons of bonus points. 2 tests and a final with a few quizzes. Still studied a lot but accounting is just hard.
rating_tags: Respected--Caring--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: TAKE HIM!!! Super organized, very professional, an overall nice guy and great professor. You dont have to go to class but I highly recommend you do because he does in class exercises that are SUPER helpful for the tests, and you get bonus points for completing them!! Hes awesome, loved his class.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Clear grading criteria--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: TAKE HIM!!! There are lot of opportunities to earn the grade that you wanted. Test are similar to those quizzes in the module.

He is very great with teaching accounting. Very informative! He tells you everything he will put on the test and reminds you about everything that will be due. He cares about his students and wants everyone to succeed in his class.

Great teacher. Explains material well, often reminded us about due dates and when he/the assistants were available for tutoring, gives extra credit for attendance. I appreciate the practice problems he gives out during class, helped alot. Only complaint is he made us complete two or three quizzes at one time (during weekends) but pretty easy class.
rating_tags: ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Clear grading criteria--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Hong is very good teacher and cares about your grade. There is extra credit based on attendance but it is possible to make up those grade so don't stress. 4 tests including final which is not commutative, 1 is online commutative. I would take him again if possible for sure
rating_tags: LOTS OF HOMEWORK--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Easily one of the best professors I've had at KSU. He does a great job of communicating with the class. He set up a class group-me where he was active and easily accessible. Tests were graded the same day.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Clear grading criteria

comment: Dr. Hong is a really caring professor. He is still new to teaching but does a great job at explaining the material and gives you many opportunities to receive a good grade. He regularly sends out reminders when important assignments are due. You don't need the book. Only 3 tests and gives sample exams and homework on connect. Should be an easy A.
rating_tags: ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Clear grading criteria--Caring

comment: He is AMAZING! I have always struggled with accounting, but he makes its understandable. He works hard to help his students understand the material and gives thourough reviews before each test. One learnsmart and one homework and chapter.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Caring

comment: Great teacher! He is new so there aren't many reviews for him so I was a little nervous going into his class. You shouldn't be, he's great. He is very helpful and tries lots of different strategies to make the class make sense to everyone. Always goes the extra mile and is ready to help outside of class hours. Just a great guy.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Caring

comment: I'm so surprised it's his first year teaching, because he did such a great job! He is accessible after classes and will work with you. He explained accounting pretty well and would totally take him again if i had the option!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Class is easier than ACCT 2100. This was his first time teaching & he did a bomb job. Super nice & positive attitude. Gave tons of extra credit. 2-3 HW assignments due each chapter but plenty of time to complete. 3 tests. He gives extra credit on tests. Tests are easy if you come to class. He breaks things done & has extended office hours. Easy A/B
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--EXTRA CREDIT
